info.title: SDC Form Manager
info.description: This profile defines the expected capabilities of the ''SDC Form Manager'' role when conforming to the S&I Framework's [[index|Structured Data Capture FHIR implementation guide]].  This role is responsible for maintaining a repository of form definitions and also of performing pre-population of form data.

contact.name: HL7 International - FHIR Infrastructure Work Group

/metadata.summary: Access to the Server's Capability Statement
/metadata.description: All FHIR Servers return a CapabilityStatement that describes what services they perform

/Questionnaire.summary: Manager for resources of type Questionnaire
/Questionnaire.description: The Manager for resources of type Questionnaire: provides services to manage the collection of all the Questionnaire instances

get.summary: Search all resources of type Questionnaire based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: A code that corresponds to one of its items in the questionnaire

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: A use context assigned to the questionnaire

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The questionnaire publication date

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: External identifier for the questionnaire

parameters.name: publisher
parameters.description: Name of the publisher of the questionnaire

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The current status of the questionnaire

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The human-friendly name of the questionnaire

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The business version of the questionnaire

parameters.name: definition
parameters.description: Allows searching by 'definition' element within a Questionnaire's items

requestBody.description: The new state of the resource

200.description: the resource being returned after being updated

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

/Questionnaire/{rid}.summary: Read/Write/etc resource instance of type Questionnaire
/Questionnaire/{rid}.description: Access to services to manage the state of a single resource of type Questionnaire

get.summary: Read the current state of the resource

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

put.summary: Update the current state of the resource

requestBody.description: The new state of the resource

200.description: the resource being returned after being updated

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

delete.summary: Delete the resource so that it no exists (no read, search etc)

204.description: If the resource is deleted - no content is returned

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

/Questionnaire/{rid}/_history.summary: Read past versions of resource instance of type Questionnaire
/Questionnaire/{rid}/_history.description: Access to previous versions of a single resource of type Questionnaire

get.summary: Read the past states of the resource

parameters.name: _since
parameters.description: Only include resource versions that were created at or after the given instant in time

parameters.name: _at
parameters.description: Only include resource versions that were current at some point during the time period specified in the date time value (see Search notes on date searching)

parameters.name: _list
parameters.description: Only include resource versions that are referenced in the specified list (current list references are allowed)

/Questionnaire/{rid}/_history/{hid}.summary: Read a past version of resource instance of type Questionnaire
/Questionnaire/{rid}/_history/{hid}.description: Access a to specified previous version of a single resource of type Questionnaire

get.summary: Read a past state of the resource

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag for that version

summary.name: _summary
summary.description: Requests the server to return a designated subset of the resource

format.name: _format
format.description: Specify alternative response formats by their MIME-types (when a client is unable acccess accept: header)

pretty.name: _pretty
pretty.description: Ask for a pretty printed response for human convenience

elements.name: _elements
elements.description: Requests the server to return a collection of elements from the resource

count.name: _count
count.description: The maximum number of search results on a page. The server is not bound to return the number requested, but cannot return more
